oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dr. C.S. Boyd and soldiers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Embracing Citizenship
Military Service
African American soldiers; African Americans in military service; African American women
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Group of seventeen African American adults, including eleven men and six women, standing on porch and porch steps. In the first row, at right are two soldiers in World War I uniforms, hats in hand, wearing leather boots and jodpher pants. An inscription on the photograph points to Dr. C.S. Boyd, who stands between the two soldiers. Photograph is stamped Brazelton at bottom.

This photograph shows Knoxville Dentist, Dr. C.S. Boyd, standing between two soldiers in World War I uniforms, along with a group of other African American adults, on the porch and steps of a Victorian-style frame house.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Dr. C.S. Boyd and soldiers, African American Photography Collection, MS.2129. University of Tennessee, Knoxville - Libraries
